is_primitive_or_not.name: Is this a built-in type in this language?

default_string_byte_encoding.name: Default byte encoding (ex: ASCII UTF-8, UTF-16, etc.)

is_in_titlecase.name: Is string formatted in title case?

does_substring_exist.name: Does a substring exist in a string?

find_start_index_of_substring.name: Find index of where a substring starts

find_start_index_of_additional_substring.name: Find index of an additional substring (or starting at another index)

find_start_index_of_substring_from_end.name: Find substring index starting at end

count_occurrences_of_substring.name: Find number of occurences of a substring

get_leftmost_characters.name: Get a specified number of characters from the left

get_rightmost_characters.name: Get a specified number of characters from the right

get_substring_from_start_and_end_index.name: Return a substring from a string based on starting and ending indices

get_substring_from_start_index_and_lengt.name: Return a substring from a string based on starting index and size of substring

capitalize_string.name: Capitalize first letter of a string

remove_whitespace.comment: isspace() is available for custom implementation
remove_whitespace.name: Remove all whitespaces from string

replace_substring.name: Replace a substring with another string

replace_all_substring.name: Replace all substring matches with another string

split_at_index.name: Split string into a list of strings at a given index

split_at_newlines.name: Split string into a list of strings at every new line character

split_at_substring.name: Split string by locating all substrings

merge_lists_into_string.name: Merge a list of strings into one string

encode_html_entities.name: Encode HTML entities in a string (ex: â„¢ to ™)

encode_url_percent.name: Encode URL percent encoding into string (ex: ' ' to %20)

parameter_format_in_order.name: Parameter used in format function if they're used in order

parameter_format_numerical.name: Parameter used in format function if they're numerically numbered

parameter_format_by_name.name: Paramater used in format function if they're named variables

code: printf("%d", age); // %i can be also used
printf("%u", age); // %u for unsigned integer format
format_as_integer.name: Format parameter as an integer

format_as_decimal.name: Format parameter as a decimal number

format_as_fixed_decimal.name: Format parameter as a fixed-point decimal number

format_as_currency.name: Format parameter as a currency number

format_as_percentage.code: %% , this format specifier prints the '%' character
format_as_percentage.name: Format parameter as a percentage number

format_number_in_scientific_notation_lit.name: Format number with scientific notation with 'e'

format_number_in_scientific_notation_big.name: Format number with scientific notation with 'E'
